title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Margaret Thatcher

C. Rose O'Reilly

D. Rachel Green

---

2. The Dow Jones Industrial Average reached its 125th birthday without succumbing to Goodhart's law. What's that?

A. If something can go wrong, it will go wrong.

B. When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure.

C. If something cannot go on forever, it will stop.

D. Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.

---

3. According to a new study, which state has the highest lifetime tax burden?

A. New York

B. New Jersey

C. Connecticut

D. Florida

---

4. Amazon agreed to buy a Hollywood studio. Which one?

A. Miracle Pictures

B. MGM

C. Paramount

D. Columbia

---

5. The massive exit package given WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann was sweetened in February -- with what?

A. A diamond as big as the Ritz

B. A Gulfstream G650ER jet

C. A Tribeca office building

D. A $245 million stock award

---

6. Who will Google partner with to develop healthcare algorithms?

A. Mehmet Oz

B. Kaiser Permanente

C. HCA Healthcare

D. The Mayo Clinic

---

7. Belarus arrested a journalist by forcing down a jet. What set of rules restricts military force against civilian aircraft?

A. The Chicago Convention

B. The Penang Protocol

C. The Cairo Concord

D. The Tenerife Treaty

---

8. Which of these is one of two step-siblings who control the James Bond movie franchise?

A. Heather Apple

B. Louise Pepper

C. Barbara Broccoli

D. Millie Oats

---

9. The children's author who created the Very Hungry Caterpillar died at 91. Name him.

A. Eric Carle

B. Donald Crews

C. Maurice Sendak

D. Ezra Jack Keats

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. B

3. B

4. B

5. D

6. C

7. A

8. C

9. A
